segments.text: I'm watching those two children with great interest.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is a brave, or perhaps foolish, little climber.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's so determined to get those cookies from the jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Look at his posture, all stretched out towards the cabinet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's involvement is also quite telling.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She stands there, arm raised, clearly expecting her reward.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a classic example of childhood mischief, well-coordinated too.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I'm rather amused by their sneaky little plan.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Though I still worry about the stool tipping over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It reminds me of things I might have done as a child.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They're definitely breaking a rule, but with a certain charm.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's quite a feat of teamwork, if you ignore the dangers.
segments.speaker: PAR
